forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 42. Southeast wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 53, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the moon hangs low over Downtown San Francisco, the evening air carries a crisp bite, with a calm ambiance settling in at a cool 42 degrees. The partially cloudy night sky reveals a glimmer of stars, hinting at the clear yet chilly morning ahead. By daybreak, expect the sun to peek through, breaking the coolness of night with a swift ascension to a daytime high of 53—a gradual retreat to the slightly cooler embrace of 51 as afternoon settles in. 

A hint of rain lurks in the afternoon, only peeking through the clouds post 4 PM, with a soft 40% chance to dampen the day. The West-Northwest winds flirt at speeds of 3 to 12 mph, barely disturbing the quiet streets. Fog may dance at the edges of the Golden Gate but is less likely to blanket the city this time. For those venturing out, a layered approach is wise—think of a lightweight jacket to fend off the morning chill, and a scarf to keep warmth around your neck as you navigate the streets. A stop at a cozy café for a warming beverage, perhaps a focus on culinary delights at a local eatery, or a stroll through quiet neighborhoods will suit you well. The day beckons softly—an invitation to linger a while longer in the embrace of a city that thrives on quiet moments.
